1.q_string: A Proton and an alpha particle both are accelerated through the same potential difference. The ratio of corresponding de-Broglie wavelengths is:
If \(10^9\) electrons move out of a body to another body every second, how much time is required to get a total charge of \(1 C\) on the other body?

Consider an excited hydrogen atom in state n moving with a velocity v (v<< c). It emits a photon in the direction of its motion and changes its state to a lower state m. Apply momentum and energy conservation principle to calculate the frequency v of the emitted radiation. Compare this with the frequency v0 emitted if the atom were at rest.

A system has two charges \(q_A=2.5 \times 10^{-7} C \) and \(q_B=-2.5 \times 10^{-7} C \) located at points \(A(0,0,-15 cm )\) and \(B (0,0,+15 cm )\), respectively. What are the total charge and electric dipote moment of the system?

A closely wound solenoid \(80 cm\) long has \(5\) layers of windings of \(400\) turns each. The diameter of the solenoid is \(1.8 cm\). If the current carried is \(8.0 A\), estimate the magnitude of \(B\) inside the solenoid near its centre.

q_option: The electron will be accelerated along the axis
The electron path will be circular about the axis
The electron will experience a force at 45° to the axis and hence execute a helical path
The electron will continue to move with uniform velocity along the axis of the solenoid
1.q_string: An electron is projected with uniform velocity along the axis of a current carrying long solenoid. Which of the following is true?
A bar magnet is cut into two equal halves by a plane parallel to the magnetic axis. From the given following physical quantities, which remains unchanged is?

A domain in ferromagnetic iron is in the form of a cube of side length \(10^{-4} m\). Estimate the number of iron atoms in the domain and the maximum possible dipole moment and magnetisation of the domain. The molecular mass of iron is \(55 g / mole\), and its density is \(7.9 g / cm ^3\). Assume that each iron atom has a dipole moment of \(9 \cdot 27 \times 10^{-24} Am ^2\):

A square loop of side \(10 cm\) and resistance \(0.5 \Omega\) is placed vertically in the east-west plane. A uniform magnetic field of \(0.10 T\) is set up across the plane in the north-east direction. The magnetic field is decreased to zero in \(0.70 s\) at a steady rate. Determine the magnitudes of induced emf and current during this time-interval:
How many electrons pass through a lamp in one minute, if the current is \(300 \mathrm{~mA}\)?
How many electrons per second flow through a filament of a \(120 \mathrm{~V}\) and \(60 \mathrm{~W}\) electric bulb? Given electric power is the product of voltage and current.

In the bohr model of hydrogen atom, the electron revolves around the nucleus in a circular path of radius \(5.1 \times 10^{-11} \mathrm{~m}\) at a frequency of \(6.8 \times 10^{15}\) revolutions per second. The equivalent current is:

Displacement current goes through the gap between the plates of a capaitor when the charge of the capacitor:

(i). does not change

(ii). change with time

(iii). increases

(iv). decreases

q_option: It is given translational motion in the field
1.q_string: A conducting loop is placed in a uniform magnetic field with its plane perpendicular to the field. An emf is induced in the loop if:
A \(15.0 \mu F\) capacitor is connected to a \(220 V , 50 Hz\) source. Find the current (rms and peak) in the circuit:

If \(100 \mathrm{~J}\) of work has to be done in moving an electric charge of \(4 \mathrm{~C}\) from a place, where potential is \(-10 \mathrm{~V}\) to another place, where potential is \(\mathrm{V}\) volt, find the value of \(\mathrm{V}\):

q_option: the rate of transmission is faster at high voltages
it is more economical due to less power loss
power cannot be transmitted at low voltages
a precaution against theft of transmission lines
1.q_string: A.C power is transmitted from a power house at a high voltage as:
A metal wire is bent in a circle of radius \(10 {~cm}\). It is given a charge of \(200\ \mu {C}\) which spreads on it uniformly. What will be the electric potential at its centre?
An electromagnetic wave propagating along north has its electric field vector upwards. Its magnetic field vector point towards:

The image of a small electric bulb fixed on the wall of a room is to be obtained on the opposite wall \(3 m\) away from a means of a large convex lens. What is the maximum possible focal length of the lens required for the purpose?

q_option: the magnification produced by a convex mirror is always less than one
a virtual, erect, same-sized image can be obtained using a plane mirror
a virtual, erect, magnifield image can be formed using a concave mirror
a real, inverted, same-sized image can be formed using a convex mirror
1.q_string: All of the following statements are correct except:
Assume that light of wavelength \(600 nm\) is coming from a star. The limit of resolution of telescope whose objective has a diameter of \(2 m\) is:
If Young's double slit experiment is performed in water:
A difference of \(2.3 eV\) separates two energy levels in an atom. What is the frequency of radiation emitted when the atom makes a transition from the upper level to the lower level?

A hydrogen atom, initially in the ground state is excited by absorbing a photon of wavelength \(980 \mathring A\). The radius of the atom in excited state, in terms of Bohr radius a, will be:

\((h c=12500 e V-\mathring A)\)
The half-life of \({ }_{92}^{238} U\) undergoing \(\alpha\)-decay is \(4.5 \times 10^9\) years. What is the activity of \(1 g\) sample of \({ }_{92}^{238} U\)?
A nucleus undergoes \(\gamma\)-decay due to:

q_option: They cannot be used with high voltage
They do not last for long time
1.q_string: Serious draw back of the semiconductor device is:
In a semiconductor, current conduction is due to_________.
A p-type semiconductor is:
